intro: Echinospermum anisacanthum, commonly known as the goatweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, and it produces small, hard-seeded fruits that are dispersed by wind.
